snippet: Mark C. Hotton, a stockbroker who introduced a producer of the musical to the mysterious investor Paul Abrams, is the subject of an unrelated federal fraud investigation.
abstract: Long Island stockbroker Mark C Hotton, who has emerged as a central figure in the spectacular collapse of the Broadway musical Rebecca, is the subject of an unrelated federal fraud investigation; inquiry into the collapse of the play is being conducted by the Federal Bureau of Investigation and federal prosecutors in Manhattan.

byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and PATRICK HEALY

lead_paragraph: Mark C. Hotton, a stockbroker who introduced a producer of the musical to the mysterious investor Paul Abrams, is the subject of an unrelated federal fraud investigation.

headline.seo: ‘Rebecca’ Go-Between Is at Center of Separate U.S. Inquiry
